poem:
### Kindness Rewind

In the post office, coins jangle,  
over counters, gestures ripple;  
a single act, seeds kindness  
in the garden of strangers—  
one bloom in the asphalt meadow,  
a softening against the hard index  
of violence. Here, small hands tip  
the scales, mend the brittle  
shell with whispers of goodwill.  
Each day, repeat: sustain.
prompt: You are the poet Simon Armitage. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Rewind and be kind: what happens if you do one act of kindness every day? It has been nearly 14 years since a chance encounter with a stranger in a post office changed Bernadette Russell’s life forever. The date was Thursday 18 August 2011. For weeks, on the news, as a series of riots broke out across cities in England, Russell had been inundated with images of young people in hoodies looting, pillaging and setting". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
